newsitem.title: MALAWI: MALAWI JOINS THE INFORMATION SUPERHIGHWAY.
newsitem.headline: MALAWI JOINS THE INFORMATION SUPERHIGHWAY.

text.p: Malawi became the latest country on the information superhighway on Wednesday as 60 people hooked up to the Internet and electronic mail for the first time.
The country's first Internet company, Malawi Net Ltd, opened business with a satellite connection to New York and a subscriber base of 60.

The firm is jointly owned by U.S.-based Comnet Corp which has a 42 percent share, Malawi's state Posts and Telecommunications Corp, which holds 38 percent, and a local trust owned by top politicians called BJL Trust with 20 percent.
Malawi's Vice-President Justin Malewezi told the launch that his ruling United Democratic Front was honouring a pledge to move away from stringent censorship and controls on information.
"Let us use the Internet to put Malawi on the world map as a peaceful country," Malewezi said.

He urged government departments, business and non- governmental organisations to use the Internet to help the country make progress, adding: "Development without information and knowledge is like a boat on a dry land."
